intro: Manulea antirrhinoides, commonly known as the Madagascar star-flower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
